sense.name: Push forcefully, make a thrusting forward, upward, or outward motion.
sense.commentary: INCLUDES: THRUST UP, THRUST OUT, THRUST FORWARD, THRUST OPEN Syntax includes: NP1(theme) THRUST[intransitive] NP1(agent) THRUST NP2
sense.examples: He thrust his chin forward. The move thrust the company into unknown territory. The front of the trains that had collided head-on thrust up into the air. He thrust out into the morning air. She thrust the window open.

sense.name: Press or force, impose; place or put with great energy.
sense.commentary: INCLUDES: THRUST INTO, THRUST ON Syntax is: NP1(agent) THRUST NP2(patient) (into) NP3(recipient)
sense.examples: She thrust the letter into his hand. He thrust the money into the hands of a beggar. She thrust her diet on him.

sense.name: Penetrate or cut through (as if) with a sharp instrument; push one's way (through).
sense.examples: She thrust her way into the meeting room. The blade thrust through his flesh. He thrust through the crowd as quick as he could.

sense.name: Force (molten rock) into pre-existing rock.
sense.examples: Volcanic rock thrust into the Earth's crust.
